snippet: The industry is warning countries that their tobacco laws violate an expanding web of treaties, raising the prospect of costly, prolonged legal battles.
abstract: Tobacco companies are pushing back against worldwide rise in antismoking laws, using little-noticed legal strategy to delay or block regulation; industry is warning countries that their tobacco laws violate expanding web of trade and investment treaties, raising prospect of costly, prolonged legal battles; opponents say strategy intimidates low- and middle-income countries from tackling one of gravest health threats facing them.
lead_paragraph: The industry is warning countries that their tobacco laws violate an expanding web of treaties, raising the prospect of costly, prolonged legal battles.

headline.main: Tobacco Firms’ Strategy Limits Poorer Nations’ Smoking Laws
headline.print_headline: Tobacco Industry Tactics Limit Poorer Nations’ Smoking Laws
